carousel_items: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after eating.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or change in taste sensation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Captopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Captopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function, but you have to take it on an empty stomach.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Compared to other ACE inhibitors, less flexible on when and how you take it. Captopril needs to be taken multiple times a day on an empty stomach.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Compared to other ACE inhibitors, less flexible on when and how you take it. Captopril needs to be taken multiple times a day on an empty stomach.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

drugs.name: Captopril

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after eating.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, cough, or change in taste sensation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Captopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Captopril can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Cough
risks_warnings.description: Taking Captopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

description_processed.orig: Taking Captopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Captopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Captopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Captopril.

description_processed.orig: Captopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Captopril.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and erectile dysfunction.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

clock.tip: Take with food to lower the chance of getting head rush.

basics.benefits_moa: Carvedilol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Carvedilol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
For people with severe heart failure, Carvedilol lowers the risk of worsening heart failure, hospitalization, and sudden death.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
For people with severe heart failure, Carvedilol lowers the risk of worsening heart failure, hospitalization, and sudden death.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: it's recommended to take it with food; it can cause swelling and weight gain.
I feel it has caused weight gain that I am unable to lose with diet and exercise.

heart rate went from in the 60's on atenolol to  90 to 100 bpm when cardiologist 
changed to coreg.

drugs.name: Coreg

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and erectile dysfunction.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Worsened chest pain; increased risk of heart attack and heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart failure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

description_processed.orig: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

carousel_items: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Sit down before taking this medicine in case you get dizzy.
Take it exactly as instructed by your doctor.
Usually relieves chest pain in 1 to 5 minutes. If pain continues, you can take up to 3 doses, with 5 minutes in between each dose. Call 911 or go to the hospital if you've taken a second dose.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make dizziness worse.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.

basics.benefits_moa: Nitroglycerin is a nitrate. It dilates blood vessels all over the body. This makes it less work for the heart to pump, which relieves heart-related chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Nitroglycerin is the fastest-working medicine to relieve chest pain, but make sure to sit down before taking it.
downsides: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule for the extended-release, ointment, and patch forms to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule for the extended-release, ointment, and patch forms to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

upsides: First-choice treatment for quick relief of heart-related chest pain (angina).
Can also be used to prevent chest pain from happening.

Available in various forms that take effect at different speeds and stay in your system for different lengths of time. Sublingual form works the fastest (1-3 minutes) but lasts the shortest in your body (25 minutes), while the patch form takes the longest to start working (30 minutes) but lasts the longest (10-12 hours). Your doctor can help you find the one that's best for you.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice treatment for quick relief of heart-related chest pain (angina).
Can also be used to prevent chest pain from happening.

Available in various forms that take effect at different speeds and stay in your system for different lengths of time. Sublingual form works the fastest (1-3 minutes) but lasts the shortest in your body (25 minutes), while the patch form takes the longest to start working (30 minutes) but lasts the longest (10-12 hours). Your doctor can help you find the one that's best for you.

userStories.identifier: attorney who wants to run, play tennis .

drugs.name: Nitrostat

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Sit down before taking this medicine in case you get dizzy.
Take it exactly as instructed by your doctor.
Usually relieves chest pain in 1 to 5 minutes. If pain continues, you can take up to 3 doses, with 5 minutes in between each dose. Call 911 or go to the hospital if you've taken a second dose.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make dizziness worse.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nitroglycerin should not be used with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. Dizziness or fainting may occur when taking Nitroglycerin when you change positions, such as going from a seated or lying down position to standing because of changes in your blood pressure, which may lead to falls. This is called orthostatic hypotension. Be very careful when changing positions, especially if you're just starting to take Nitroglycerin or if changes in dosing have to be made. Talk to your doctor if you have persistent dizziness or rapid heart rate for more than 1 week.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of erectile dysfunction medicine

description_processed.orig: Nitroglycerin should not be used with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. Dizziness or fainting may occur when taking Nitroglycerin when you change positions, such as going from a seated or lying down position to standing because of changes in your blood pressure, which may lead to falls. This is called orthostatic hypotension. Be very careful when changing positions, especially if you're just starting to take Nitroglycerin or if changes in dosing have to be made. Talk to your doctor if you have persistent dizziness or rapid heart rate for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance
risks_warnings.description: Your body can get used to Nitroglycerin and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.

This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.
